marketNews.title: ðŸ‘Ž US Manufacturing and Employment Data Weakens
marketNews.content: Several US economic data points were released on Friday local time (1/11) with weak results. The released data were the Purchasing Manufacturing Index (PMI) and nonfarm payroll (NFP) - employment levels outside the agricultural sector. PMI Below 50, US Manufacturing Contracts for 7 Months The US Institute for Supply Management (ISM) documented that the Purchasing Manufacturing Index (PMI) in October 2024 dropped to 46.5 (vs September 2024: 47.2), the lowest since July 2023. This result signals contraction in the manufacturing sector for seven consecutive months. The weak data result is attributed to Boeing employee strikes. NFP Growth Falls, Lowest Since December 2020 The US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) recorded NFP at +12,000 in October 2024. This realization is much lower compared to the average NFP increase of +194,000 over the previous 12 months and the economist expectation of +113,000 based on a Reuters survey. This achievement also indicates the lowest growth since December 2020. The weak NFP growth in October 2024 was caused by a decrease in jobs in the manufacturing sector and professional and business services. The weak NFP data was also driven by Hurricanes Helene and Milton. The Boeing strike also became a strong catalyst for the weakening of the existing data. This result caused the unemployment rate in October 2024 to be flat at 4.1% (vs September 2024: 4.1%). Furthermore, the BLS also revised down NFP growth in August to +78,000 (-51%) and September to +223,000 (-12%), both dropping by -112,000 from previous reports. NFP data is the last crucial data released before the US election officially begins. Nevertheless, surveys still show the incumbent, Harris, has an edge over Trump in the upcoming US election. According to the National Polling Average by The New York Times/Siena College (3/11), Harris still leads by 49% (vs. Trump: 48%). The sentiment for Harris's victory is also supported by five other surveys. Responding to this data, the probability of the Fed cutting interest rates by -50 bps until the end of 2024 as of Monday (4/11) rose to 82% (vs. 28/10: 69%), based on the CME FedWatch Tool. The US Dollar Index (DXY) weakened by -0.47% to 103.8 and the 10-year Treasury yield fell by -9 bps to 4.29%. Key Takeaway The weak US economic data increased the probability of US interest rate cuts by -25bps in November and December, respectively. This is reflected in the rise in the probability of an interest rate cut over the past week by 4pp in November to 99.8% and 12pp in December to 81.5%. This US interest rate cut sentiment has the potential to create room for strengthening of the Rupiah exchange rate and further monetary easing by BI. Based on Bloomberg consensus as of November 4, 2024, BI is expected to cut interest rates by a minimum of -25 bps until the end of 2024, the same as the expectation as of October 7. The Indonesian government's 10-year bond yield fell -3 bps WoW to 6.79% today (11/4). However, the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar continued to weaken -0.18% WoW to 15,753.

marketNews.title: Indonesia Plans to Increase Minimum Period Exporters Retain Earnings
marketNews.content: Reuters reported that the Indonesian government will revise the foreign exchange earning regulations from the proceeds of natural resource exports (DHE-SDA) by extending the mandatory period for placing DHE-SDA in the domestic financial system for exporters. This rule is intended to increase the supply of domestic foreign exchange amid continued pressure on the Rupiah in recent weeks. Currently, DHE-SDA based on Government Regulation Number 36/2023 requires exporters to deposit 30% of DHE-SDA in the domestic financial system for a minimum period of 3 months.

marketNews.title: Government to Extend Tax Holiday Incentive Until December 2025 for Pioneer Industries
marketNews.content: The government will extend the income tax exemption incentive for corporations, or tax holiday, for a certain period until December 2025 for pioneer industries that invest capital in Indonesia. However, tax holiday recipients will still pay 15% Income Tax along with the implementation of the global minimum tax next year. The Minister of Investment and Downstreaming and Head of the Investment Coordinating Board, Rosan Roeslani, stated that the government can still provide other forms of incentives for related companies. For information, Rosan Roslani stated that this tax holiday program has contributed more than 25% to investment realization in Indonesia.

marketNews.title: Minister Erick Thohir Optimistic State-Owned Enterprises Dividend Remittance Target of IDR 90 Trillion in 2025 Can Be Achieved
marketNews.content: The Minister of State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN), Erick Thohir, is optimistic that the target for BUMN dividend remittance in 2025 of IDR 90 trillion can be achieved. This target is an increase compared to the BUMN dividend remittance target in the 2024 State Budget set at IDR 85.54 trillion.

marketNews.title: Government to Extend Tax Incentives, Including for Housing and Electric Vehicles, Until Next Year
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartanto, stated that the government will extend tax incentives, including for the housing and electric vehicle sectors, until next year. The extension of incentives in the form of Value Added Tax borne by the government (PPN-DTP) and luxury goods sales tax borne by the government (PPnBM-DTP) has not yet detailed the budget size and incentive quotas. Airlangga said the policy was taken by the government to encourage public purchasing power so that the economy can grow significantly.

marketNews.title: Government Prepares Three Dairy Cattle Farms for Vietnamese Investors
marketNews.content: The Minister of Agriculture, Andi Amran Sulaiman, conveyed that the government has prepared 3 lands totaling 92 hectares for dairy cattle farming to be managed by investors from Vietnam. These three lands will be located in Central Sulawesi, South Kalimantan, and South Sulawesi, with the land in Poso, Central Sulawesi having been reviewed with the Vietnamese company, TH Group.

marketNews.title: Volkswagen Plans Mass Layoffs, Factory Closures, and Salary Cuts
marketNews.content: The workers' council of the German car manufacturer, Volkswagen (VW), stated that VW plans mass layoffs, factory closures, and employee salary cuts. The workers' council mentioned that VW will close at least 3 factories in Germany and lay off tens of thousands of employees.

tickerNews.title: ACESS Controller Buys ACES Shares Worth IDR 15 Billion
tickerNews.content: ACES Controller, PT Kawan Lama Sejahtera, purchased 16.9 million ACES shares at an average price of 905 rupiah per share on October 28, 2024. The total transaction value reached 15.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Kawan Lama Sejahtera's ownership in ACES increased from 59.9% to 60%.

tickerNews.title: Intiland Development President Director Sells 260 Million DILD Shares for Investment Divestment
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Intiland Development, Hendro S Gondokusumo, sold 260 million DILD shares at an average price of 200 rupiah per share on October 29, 2024. The total transaction value reached 52 billion rupiah and was intended for investment divestment. After this transaction, Hendro S Gondokusumo's ownership in DILD decreased from 2.51% to 0%.

tickerNews.title: Medikaloka Hermina Director Buys ~8 Million HEAL Shares
tickerNews.content: Director of Medikaloka Hermina, Yulisar Khiat, bought approximately 8 million HEAL shares at an average price of 1,549 rupiah per share between October 15-28, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 12.3 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Yulisar's ownership in HEAL increased from 12.56% to 12.61%.

tickerNews.title: Puradelta Lestari Signs IDR 1.5 Trillion Credit Facility Agreement with Bank Mandiri (BMRI)
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari signed a credit facility agreement worth 1.5 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) on October 30, 2024. The credit facility will be used for development in the Deltamas Area, West Java, for a tenor of 5 years from the signing date.

tickerNews.title: Mutuagung Lestari Controller Sells 100 Million MUTU Shares
tickerNews.content: The Controller of Mutuagung Lestari, PT Afda Ekselensi Lintas Dunia, sold 100 million MUTU shares at an average price of 85 rupiah per share on October 24, 2024. The total transaction value reached 8.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Afda Ekselensi Lintas Dunia's ownership in MUTU decreased from 10.5% to 7.32%.

tickerNews.title: Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology to Distribute IDR 301.6 Billion Interim Dividend for 2024 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Sinar Mas Agro Resources and Technology will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 301.6 billion rupiah or 105 rupiah per share. The cum dividend in the regular and negotiated market is on November 11, 2024, with payment on November 20, 2024. Referring to SMAR's stock price on Monday (4/11) at 4,250 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 2.5%.

tickerNews.title: MD Entertainment Completes Acquisition of 80.05% of Net Visi Media (NETV)
tickerNews.content: MD Entertainment has completed the acquisition of 80.05% of Net Visi Media (NETV) shares at an execution price of 50 rupiah per share on October 25 and 29, 2024. The total transaction value reached 1.7 trillion rupiah. Previously, FILM had announced the plan for this acquisition on August 28, 2024.
